task.title: Deleting an OAuth profile by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete OAuth profiles by using the delete OAuthProfile command on the command line.

context.p: You can delete an OAuth profile by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete an OAuth profile, see .
context.note: You cannot delete an OAuth profile that is associated with a security profile. First, remove the OAuth profile from the associated security profile, and then delete the OAuth profile.

step.cmd: To delete an OAuth profile, enter the following command:
step.info:
delete OAuthProfile "Name=name"Where:
name Specifies the name of the OAuth profile that you want to delete.
